description: The mission of the Uber API is to make it easy for developers to unlock the power of our logistical network that runs across cities.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The access token obtained from Uber API.

args.name: itemsTitle
args.info: The title of the item. Limited to 128 characters.

args.name: itemsQuantity
args.info: The number of this item.

args.name: itemsPrice
args.info: The price of the item.

args.name: itemsCurrencyCode
args.info: The currency code of the item price. The currency code follows the ISO 4217 standard.

args.name: pickupLocationAddress
args.info: The top address line of the delivery pickup location.

args.name: pickupLocationCity
args.info: The city of the delivery pickup location.

args.name: pickupLocationState
args.info: The state of the delivery pickup location such as "CA".

args.name: pickupLocationPostalCode
args.info: The postal code of the delivery pickup location.

args.name: pickupLocationCountry
args.info: The country of the pickup location such as "US".

args.name: pickupContactFirstName
args.info: The first name of the contact. This field is optional if pickup.contact.company_name is provided. Limited to 128 characters.

args.name: pickupContactLastName
args.info: The last name of the contact. This field is optional if pickup.contact.company_name is provided. Limited to 128 characters.

args.name: pickupContactEmail
args.info: The email of the contact.

args.name: pickupContactPhoneNumber
args.info: The phone number of the contact. Phone number should start with + followed by the country code and then the local number (e.g., +18005555555).

args.name: dropoffLocationAddress
args.info: The top address line of the delivery drop-off location.

args.name: dropoffLocationAddress2
args.info: The second address line of the delivery drop-off location such as the apartment number. Limited to 128 characters.

args.name: dropoffLocationCity
args.info: The city of the delivery drop-off location.

args.name: dropoffLocationState
args.info: The state of the delivery drop-off location such as "CA".

args.name: dropoffLocationPostalCode
args.info: The postal code of the delivery drop-off location.

args.name: dropoffLocationCountry
args.info: The country of the delivery pickup location such as "US".

args.name: dropoffContactFirstName
args.info: The first name of the contact. Limited to 128 characters.

args.name: dropoffContactLastName
args.info: The last name of the contact. Limited to 128 characters.

args.name: dropoffContactEmail
args.info: The email of the contact.

args.name: dropoffContactPhoneNumber
args.info: The phone number of the contact.

args.name: dropoffContactPhoneSmsEnabled
args.info: If the phone has SMS capabilities. True or false.

args.name: quoteId
args.info: Optional: The ID of the quoted price of the delivery. This field is optional. If missing, the fee for the delivery will be determined at the time of request.

args.name: orderReferenceId
args.info: Optional: The merchant-supplied order reference identifier. This field is optional. Limited to 256 characters.

args.name: itemsWidth
args.info: Optional: The width of the item in inches.

args.name: itemsHeight
args.info: Optional: The height of the item in inches.

args.name: itemsLength
args.info: Optional: The length of the item in inches.

args.name: itemsWeight
args.info: Optional: The weight of the item in pounds.

args.name: itemsIsFragile
args.info: Optional: If the item is fragile. True or false. Default to false.

args.name: pickupLocationAddress2
args.info: Optional: The second address line of the delivery pickup location such as the apartment number. Limited to 128 characters.

args.name: pickupLocationLatitude
args.info: Optional: Latitude of the pickup location. If UberRUSH cannot geocode the given address, the latitude and longitude coordinates will be used if provided.

args.name: pickupLocationLongitude
args.info: Optional: Longitude of the pickup location. If UberRUSH cannot geocode the given address, the latitude and longitude coordinates will be used if provided.

args.name: pickupContactCompanyName
args.info: Optional: The company name of the contact. Limited to 128 characters.

args.name: pickupContactPhoneSmsEnabled
args.info: Optional: If the phone has SMS capabilities. True or false.

args.name: pickupSpecialInstructions
args.info: Optional: Special instructions for the pickup. Limited to 256 characters.

args.name: dropoffLocationLatitude
args.info: Optional: Latitude of the dropoff location. If UberRUSH cannot geocode the given address, the latitude and longitude coordinates will be used if provided.

args.name: dropoffLocationLongitude
args.info: Optional: Longitude of the dropoff location. If UberRUSH cannot geocode the given address, the latitude and longitude coordinates will be used if provided.

args.name: dropoffContactSendEmailNotifications
args.info: Optional: If Uber should send email delivery notifications. True or false. Default to true.

args.name: dropoffContactSendSmsNotifications
args.info: Optional: If Uber should send SMS delivery notifications. True or false. Default to true.

args.name: dropoffSpecialInstructions
args.info: Optional: Special instructions for the drop-off. Limited to 256 characters.

args.name: dropoffSignatureRequired
args.info: Optional: If signature is required for drop-off. True or false. Default to false.

args.name: includesAlcohol
args.info: Optional: Indicates if the delivery includes alcohol. True or false. This feature is only available to whitelisted businesses.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The access token key obtained from Uber API.

args.name: deliveryId
args.info: Unique identifier representing a Delivery.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The access token key obtained from Uber API.

args.name: deliveryId
args.info: Unique identifier representing a Delivery.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The access token key obtained from Uber API.

args.name: offset
args.info: Offset the list of returned results by this amount.

args.name: limit
args.info: Number of items to retrieve. Maximum is 50.

args.name: status
args.info: A status value to filter for. List of status strings can be found https://developer.uber.com/docs/rush/statuses. Additionally supports a value of active that will return all ongoing deliveries. A delivery is considered active if the status field value is either en_route_to_pickup, at_pickup, en_route_to_dropoff or at_dropoff.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The access token obtained from Uber API.

args.name: pickupLocationAddress
args.info: The top address line of the delivery pickup location.

args.name: pickupLocationCity
args.info: The city of the delivery pickup location.

args.name: pickupLocationState
args.info: The state of the delivery pickup location such as "CA".

args.name: pickupLocationPostalCode
args.info: The postal code of the delivery pickup location.

args.name: pickupLocationCountry
args.info: The country of the pickup location such as "US".

args.name: dropoffLocationAddress
args.info: The top address line of the delivery drop-off location.

args.name: dropoffLocationAddress2
args.info: The second address line of the delivery drop-off location such as the apartment number. Limited to 128 characters.

args.name: dropoffLocationCity
args.info: The city of the delivery drop-off location.

args.name: dropoffLocationState
args.info: The state of the delivery drop-off location such as "CA".

args.name: dropoffLocationPostalCode
args.info: The postal code of the delivery drop-off location.

args.name: dropoffLocationCountry
args.info: The country of the delivery pickup location such as "US".

args.name: pickupLocationAddress2
args.info: Optional: The second address line of the delivery pickup location such as the apartment number. Limited to 128 characters.

args.name: pickupLocationLatitude
args.info: Optional: Latitude of the pickup location. If UberRUSH cannot geocode the given address, the latitude and longitude coordinates will be used if provided.

args.name: pickupLocationLongitude
args.info: Optional: Longitude of the pickup location. If UberRUSH cannot geocode the given address, the latitude and longitude coordinates will be used if provided.

args.name: dropoffLocationLatitude
args.info: Optional: Latitude of the dropoff location. If UberRUSH cannot geocode the given address, the latitude and longitude coordinates will be used if provided.

args.name: dropoffLocationLongitude
args.info: Optional: Longitude of the dropoff location. If UberRUSH cannot geocode the given address, the latitude and longitude coordinates will be used if provided.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The access token obtained from Uber API.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The access token obtained from Uber API.

args.name: offset
args.info: Optional: Offset the list of returned results by this amount. Default is zero.

args.name: limit
args.info: Optional: Number of items to retrieve. Default is 5, maximum is 50.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The access token obtained from Uber API.

args.name: productId
args.info: Unique identifier representing a specific product for a given latitude & longitude. For example, uberX in San Francisco will have a different product_id than uberX in Los Angeles.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The access token obtained from Uber API.

args.name: requestId
args.info: Unique identifier representing a Request.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The access token obtained from Uber API.

args.name: latitude
args.info: Latitude component of location.

args.name: longitude
args.info: Longitude component of location.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The access token obtained from Uber API.

args.name: startLatitude
args.info: Latitude component of start location.

args.name: startLongitude
args.info: Longitude component of start location.

args.name: endLatitude
args.info: Latitude component of end location.

args.name: endLongitude
args.info: Longitude component of end location.

args.name: seatCount
args.info: Optional: The number of seats required for uberPOOL. Default and maximum value is 2.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The access token obtained from Uber API.

args.name: startLatitude
args.info: Latitude component.

args.name: startLongitude
args.info: Longitude component.

args.name: productId
args.info: Optional: Unique identifier representing a specific product for a given latitude & longitude.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The access token obtained from Uber API.

args.name: placeName
args.info: The name of the place to retrieve. Only home and work are acceptable.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The access token obtained from Uber API.

args.name: placeName
args.info: The name of the place to retrieve. Only home and work are acceptable.

args.name: address
args.info: The address of the place that should be tied to the given placeName.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The access token obtained from Uber API.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The access token obtained from Uber API. This endpoint only supports server_token.

args.name: reminderTime
args.info: Unix UTC timestamp of when the reminder will occur.

args.name: phoneNumber
args.info: Phone number of the individual to remind. Must be in the E.164 format.

args.name: eventTime
args.info: Unix UTC timestamp of the event time.

args.name: eventName
args.info: Optional: Formatted name of the event, which appears in the reminder notification. Alphanumeric up to 50 characters. Defaults to “Your event” if no name is provided.

args.name: eventLocation
args.info: Optional: Location of the event, which appears in the Uber app destination field. This does not need to be the entire address string since we rely on the event lat/long to set the destination pin, i.e., “Coit Tower” is sufficient instead of "Coit Tower, 1 Telegraph Hill Blvd, San Francisco, CA 94133".

args.name: eventLatitude
args.info: Optional: Latitude of the event location. Required to set destination pin.

args.name: eventLongitude
args.info: Optional: Longitude of the event location. Required to set destination pin.

args.name: eventProductId
args.info: Optional: Product ID of the Uber product to request. This overrides the product selected by the latitude / longitude pair. Required to set destination pin.

args.name: tripBrandingLinkText
args.info: Optional: Call-to-action text for the deeplink to your app. Used for trip branding and personalization.

args.name: tripBrandingPartnerDeeplink
args.info: Optional: Deeplink URL to a page in your app where your users can view relevant information and perform actions that will enhance the post-trip experience. Used for trip branding and personalization.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The access token obtained from Uber API. This endpoint only supports server_token.

args.name: reminderId
args.info: The reminder ID.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The access token obtained from Uber API. This endpoint only supports server_token.

args.name: reminderId
args.info: The reminder ID.

args.name: reminderTime
args.info: Unix UTC timestamp of when the reminder will occur.

args.name: phoneNumber
args.info: Phone number of the individual to remind. Must be in the E.164 format.

args.name: eventTime
args.info: Unix UTC timestamp of the event time.

args.name: eventName
args.info: Optional: Formatted name of the event, which appears in the reminder notification. Alphanumeric up to 50 characters. Defaults to “Your event” if no name is provided.

args.name: eventLocation
args.info: Optional: Location of the event, which appears in the Uber app destination field. This does not need to be the entire address string since we rely on the event lat/long to set the destination pin, i.e., “Coit Tower” is sufficient instead of "Coit Tower, 1 Telegraph Hill Blvd, San Francisco, CA 94133".

args.name: eventLatitude
args.info: Optional: Latitude of the event location. Required to set destination pin.

args.name: eventLongitude
args.info: Optional: Longitude of the event location. Required to set destination pin.

args.name: eventProductId
args.info: Optional: Product ID of the Uber product to request. This overrides the product selected by the latitude / longitude pair. Required to set destination pin.

args.name: tripBrandingLinkText
args.info: Optional: Call-to-action text for the deeplink to your app. Used for trip branding and personalization.

args.name: tripBrandingPartnerDeeplink
args.info: Optional: Deeplink URL to a page in your app where your users can view relevant information and perform actions that will enhance the post-trip experience. Used for trip branding and personalization.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The access token obtained from Uber API.

args.name: startLatitude
args.info: The beginning or “pickup” latitude. Either this or startPlaceId must be specified.

args.name: startLongitude
args.info: The beginning or “pickup” longitude. Either this or startPlaceId must be specified.

args.name: endLatitude
args.info: The final or destination latitude. Either this or endPlaceId may be specified. If requesting POOL, this parameter is required.

args.name: endLongitude
args.info: The final or destination longitude. Either this or endPlaceId may be specified. If requesting POOL, this parameter is required.

args.name: startPlace_id
args.info: Optional: The beginning or “pickup” place ID. This is the name of an Uber saved place. Only “home” or “work” is acceptable. Either this or startLatitude and startLongitude must be specified.

args.name: endPlace_id
args.info: Optional: The final or destination place ID. This is the name of an Uber saved place. Only “home” or “work” is acceptable. Either this or endLatitude and endLongitude may be specified.

args.name: startNickname
args.info: Optional: The beginning or “pickup” nickname label.

args.name: endNickname
args.info: Optional: The final or destination nickname label.

args.name: startAddress
args.info: Optional: The beginning or “pickup” address.

args.name: endAddress
args.info: Optional: The final or destination address.

args.name: productId
args.info: Optional: The unique ID of the product being requested. If none is provided, it will default to the cheapest product for the given location.

args.name: surgeConfirmationId
args.info: Optional: The unique identifier of the surge session for a user. Required when returned from a 409 Conflict response on previous POST attempt.

args.name: paymentMethodId
args.info: Optional: The unique identifier of the payment method selected by a user. If set, the trip will be requested using this payment method. If not set, the trip will be requested using the user’s last used payment method.

args.name: seatCount
args.info: Optional: The number of seats required for uberPOOL. Default and maximum value is 2.

args.name: fareId
args.info: Optional: The key for the upfront price of an uberPOOL ride. Required if we want to use a previously retrieved price estimate for POOL. If it is missed, we will automatically issue a new upfront price for the ride request.

args.name: expenseCode
args.info: Optional: An alphanumeric identifier for expense reporting policies. This value will appear in the trip receipt and any configured expense-reporting integrations like Uber For Business or Business Profiles.

args.name: expenseMemo
args.info: Optional: A free text field to describe the purpose of the trip for expense reporting. This value will appear in the trip receipt and any configured expense-reporting integrations like Uber For Business or Business Profiles.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The access token obtained from Uber API.

args.name: endLatitude
args.info: Optional: The final or destination latitude. Either this or endPlaceId must be specified.

args.name: endLongitude
args.info: Optional: The final or destination longitude. Either this or endPlaceId must be specified.

args.name: endAddress
args.info: Optional: The final or destination address.

args.name: endNickname
args.info: Optional: The final or destination nickname label.

args.name: endPlaceId
args.info: Optional: The final or destination place ID. This is the name of an Uber saved place. Only “home” or “work” is accepted. Either this or endLatitude and endLongitude must be specified.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The access token obtained from Uber API.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The access token obtained from Uber API.

args.name: productId
args.info: Optional: The unique ID of the product being requested. If none is provided, it will default to the cheapest product for the given location.

args.name: startLatitude
args.info: Optional: The beginning or "pickup" latitude. Either this or startPlaceId must be specified.

args.name: startLongitude
args.info: Optional: The beginning or "pickup" longitude. Either this or startPlaceId must be specified.

args.name: startPlaceId
args.info: Optional: The beginning or “pickup” place ID. This is the name of an Uber saved place. Only “home” or “work” is acceptable. Either this or startLatitude and startLongitude must be specified.

args.name: endLatitude
args.info: Optional: The final or destination latitude. If not included, only the pickup ETA and details of surge pricing will be included.

args.name: endLongitude
args.info: Optional: The final or destination longitude. If not included, only the pickup ETA and details of surge pricing will be included.

args.name: endPlaceId
args.info: Optional: The final or destination place ID. This is the name of an Uber saved place. Only “home” or “work” is acceptable. Either this or endLatitude and endLongitude may be specified.

args.name: seatCount
args.info: Optional: The number of seats required for uberPOOL. Default and maximum value is 2.

args.info: The access token obtained from Uber API.

args.info: Unique identifier representing a Request.

args.info: Optional: The final or destination latitude. Either this or endPlaceId must be specified.

args.name: endAddress

args.name: endNickname

args.name: endPlaceId
